boolean endOfFile

ACs

int[][][][][] ACs
This array contains AC components of the recovered segment. Usage : ACs[block][resolutionLevel][family][x][y]

DCs

int[] DCs
This array contains DC components of the recovered segment. Usage : DCs[block]

CVerbose

boolean[] CVerbose
Defintion in Decoder.CVerbose

codeWordLength

int codeWordLength
Defintion in RecommendedOrder.codeWordLength

gammaValue

float gammaValue
This float indicates the point of the interval where values are recovered in the decoding process. When decoding a value inside an interval is possible to approximate this value to the middle value of the interval, to the low value, to 0,25 of the interval, to ... Example: in bit plane 3, a recovered value can be approximated to 8 (low value) or to 12 (middle value) Valid values are real numbers in the interval [0,1). For example:
  • 0.0 - Lower value (gamma = 0)
  • 0.5 - Middle value (gamma = 1/2)
  • 0.375 - 3/8 of the threshold value (gamma = 3/8)

completionMode

int completionMode
Definition in InitialDecoding.completionMode

private void putDCs(int[] DCs_2s_comp,
                    int bitPlane,
                    int BPLL)
Places DC components in their position inside the segment. It also gives an approximation to the middle value

Parameters:
DCs_2s_comp - integer array containing DC components in two's-complement
bitPlane - indicates the bitplane that must be refined

public void putDCBlock(int blockNumber,
                       int value,
                       int bitPlane,
                       int BPLL)
Receives a DC component in two's-complement and represents them with signed representation.

Parameters:
blockNumber - indicates the position of the block containing this DC inside the segment
value - contains the DC value
bitPlane - indicates the bitplane that must be refined
BPLL - defintion in InitialCoding.BPLL
